workspace

Class XMLStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • workspace.XMLStore

  • public class XMLStore
extends java.lang.Object
    Links my game to save and load local xml data from "RPS_Data.xml" in the user working directory.
    Author:
    Mark

    • Method Detail

      • determineAndSetGameWinner

        public void determineAndSetGameWinner()
        Sets the game winner attribute within the active game element based on the game winner.

      • determineGameWinner

        public int determineGameWinner()
        Determines the game winner based on player round wins vs player round loses
        Returns:
        - The winner of the game in int form. (1:Player; 2:CPU)

      • getAttributeOfActiveGameElement

        public java.lang.String getAttributeOfActiveGameElement(java.lang.String name)
        Gets an attribute of the active game element in use.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the attribute to retrieve.
        Returns:
        - The value of the attribute in string form. If nonexistent, returns null.

      • setAttributeOfActiveGameElement

        public void setAttributeOfActiveGameElement(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String to)
        Sets an attribute of the active game element in use.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the attribute to create or alter.
        to - - Value to set in string form.

      • getActiveGameElement

        public org.w3c.dom.Element getActiveGameElement()
        Uses Link.activeGame to attempt identifying and will return a game element tagged to that number if found.
        Returns:
        - If found, returns an Element. If the element cannot be found, it returns null.

      • getAvailableNumberToNameGame

        public java.lang.String getAvailableNumberToNameGame()
        Counts the number of elements in the saved XML document that are named "game" and adds one to that number.
        Returns:
        - A string representing the next available number to create an identifying tag for a game.

      • makeNewGame

        public void makeNewGame()
        Makes a new xml element and places it in the saved xml document. Also sets the activeGame variable to the new element's ID number.

      • Do

        public void Do(java.lang.String w)
        When you ask to "create", the method creates a new XML document if it does not already exist. Then it saves the document in the application's working directory and equals Link.doc When you ask to "save", the method saves Link.doc to the XML document in the application's working directory.
        Parameters:
        w - ("save", "create")
